page.title: 11COMMON FARM
page.content:
At Kate's farm they deal in crops but they also keep pigs. The sows and boars are kept separate. The sows are taken to the sow vans to have their babies. The pens are specially made so that the sows can't lie on their babies by mistake. Mr. Halden has to pull the piglets' baby teeth out so that when they feed they don't make the mother sore or hurt one another when they're playing. He also has to dock each piglet's curly tail, or the other piglets would chew the brown, hairy bit on it. From there the piglets are put in stacked cages where they seem quite happy. Finally they go to fatness dens until they are 16 weeks, then they go to market.
by Ella and Bronwyn
